biography:
Claude Zidi (born 25 July 1934) is a French film director and screenwriter who is noted for his mainstream burlesque comedies. Born in Paris, he started as a cameraman and then a cinematographer, and he made his directorial and screenwriting debut in 1971. He won the CÃ©sar Award for Best Director for My New Partner, for which he was also nominated for Best Writing.
